Behaviour has finally killed off Dead by daylight by nerfing the only thing that kept this game in balance (Decisive Strike) Now it's just a tunneling party and there is basically no skill requied to play killer like in the old days. Now you have bloodlust, stupid perks that kill of survivor perks/items with no effort and hitboxes bigger than actual trains.

I would NOT buy this game at all, don't even play this if it's free!

This game has it's issues and is missing some sorely needed functionalities. If this game was a full price $60 then I wouldn't recommend it but for $20 on the standard edition and $30 for the deluxe? As the killer, certain tactics the survivors utilize need to be nerfed or what they are using to utilize this tactic to either be a shorter walk to them instead of playing a futile game of cat and mouse where the survivor can cheese the killer for days, especially if they are the last survivor active in the game.

Game settings are rather limited as in you cannot individually tweak settings and they are lumped together under the presets of low, medium, high, and ultra as an example. There is not a separate slider for music and all sounds are lumped under a master volume bar. V-sync is on by default which may dissaude others but personally I like V-sync to be on. Game forces borderless full screen beware of having Skype on in the background.

All and all, you get a decent game but still has it's issues and options that need to be present. But still I think it's worth the $20 at the very least.

So probably by glancing at the reviews you've already seen people complain about the lobby system. People jumping in and our and ridiculous wait times. I found it was a fit eaiser to jump into games when your a survivor. but you can still expect some kind of wait time normally. But if your like me you bought this game to play as the killer. Which oh boy there were some crazy wait times. I actually put on the tv and watched it while i was waiting. There was actually one time where finished an entire episode before i actually got into game. Now it wasn't always THAT long. But it was pretty much at least a 5 minutes wait if not more then that. Its not because its slow but because people keep jumping in and out and all you can do is wait. there needs to be some kind of party system or something done so your not just sitting there wait and waiting, Ive seen people encounter lobby errors, but i havn't encounted it myself. Nor was i ever been disconnected while finally in game.

SInce it is day one I did encounter two glitches. One where one of the survivors was just invisible to me. I didnt realize this until they were hiding in one of those hut things and i opened it, nothing was there but i got the animation for picking them up and only could see them when they were put on the hook. i guess its possible the person cheated some how? but i think it was just some kind of glitch. Again while being the killer i had someone on the ground up against a wall. when i picked them up neither of us could move, totally stuck in place. Still stuck even long after they should of been dropped.

AND YET
All that being said i still recommend this game. Yes, the lobby is an issue. yes i encouted a bug or two. but i love this game so much that i will would yes to this game. The game play is addicting and i love the leveling up system. it drives you to just go one more round just to get to the next level and see what you'll get.Enviroments have some really cool details when you get the time to look around. my favorite is the one with all the animal corpses, very creepy. This game is so fun, and so addicting.  If anything I might suggested waiting a little bit. Im sure they will fix everything i mentioned prior (especially since everyone is complaining about it) give it time I am sure it will improve. but if you can deal with the wait time i say go for it, its a blast. other wise maybe wait until they fix things a bit.

I RECOMMEND THIS GAME COMPLETELY - BUT PLEASE READ
[u]Pros[/u]
It's a fun game, not so much as scary but tense.
You can choose to save or abandon people which is kinda great, it brings out the monster in all of us lol.
Each map has random generator spawns which can give advantage to the player, and you can also be awarded "Offerings" which can be used to alter the map and it's surroundings to either help the Killer or the player.

[u]Cons[/u]
There is no party system yet(although I hear it is their top priority), so you can either go solo for a while until this comes out, or you can try and join the same game as your friends(easy but can take a anywhere between 1-15 mins). ALTHOUGH you CAN play a private match with your friends however no XP is rewarded, as can be expected.
Also the Killers are great, however I don't like the idea of the wraith, the fact that he can go invisible is kinda OP(however the player is alerted when he goes invisible by a bell tolling and he cannot interact or attack when invisible, which kinda makes up for it) but overall I think the character itself is a little OP.
Also - and I think alot of people would agree, when you are hung up on a hook, most killers, if not ALL, will just camp the hook, which in my opinion is kinda bad because it's basically setting you up for a GG, although when the killer camps the hook it allows for everyone else to fix generators and escape, thus making a "loss" on the killers part.

[u]Overall[/u]
Is a great game and is worth its money, you could play hours on end without getting bored as each map variant offers great advantages and disadvantages to killer and player alike - You will NEVER always win at this game, teamwork is KEY, however you could pull a sneaky Shane on Otis from TWD and escape alone :D. However a small tweaking for friends to connect and play with each other is much needed, and personally I feel the Wraith Killer could be minorly tweaked.

Dead by Daylight is an incredibly intense 1 vs 4 multiplayer horror game where you're either chased by a deranged killer or you're trying to escape him. Both are pretty much equally entertaining!

Playing as a survivor you need to start 5 generators to power a switch that opens the door to safety. This can be achieved by working together with the other survivors or you can use them as bait and let them be tortured to death while you run away in panic like a little coward. Just like in most teen slasher movies.

When you play the killer your only task is to make sure they all die. Capture them, put them on meat hooks or watch them crawl around in their own blood while their friends watch helplessly from a distance. Awesome fun!

Maps are procedurally generated, but they contain much of the same stuff anyway, you just never know the location of generators, exits, houses etc when starting a new game. This makes every match fresh and no two matches will ever be the same. You'll also never know which of the killers will be hunting you.

Watching people play on twitch or youtube is good fun and all, but you won't understand how intense this game is until you play it yourself.

Highly recommended!

(Ranked matchmaking with friends will be added in a patch, but for now you can play unranked matches with your friends. You don't even need a full group to play.)

This is one of the best asymmetrical multiplayer games on the market; however, in it's current state it is not what you want to be spending your time or money on.

NOTE: The following is a list of problems myself and those I have played with have experienced. This game has such potential and I would love to see this become massive, I do not write this out of rage but helpful criticism. I want this game to stay around and not die out do to poor implementation.

There is NO PARTY QUEUEING, is my, and many others, biggest grievance. You can still play with your friends in a private match sure, but unless you have 5 friends on at the same time, which for the vast majority of players doesn't happen very much if at all.

There is NO IN GAME COMMUNICATION. That's right, none. Players of this game can confirm, there is no greater frustration than not being able to say: DON'T COME TO ME, THE KILLER IS CAMPING, among other things.

There is CONSTANT FRAME LAG. Not persistant to where it is a problem every second, but often when important things are happening, such as skill checks, jumping through window, getting hit, or doing anything you don't want to be "lagging" while doing. Frustrating to say the least.

Matchmaking has a laundry list of problems: failing to join, joining as a ghost, joining as a glitched model that crashes your game, flat out being kicked from matchmaking for no reason among the most noticable, as well as being placed with people who have items/perks that outclass you by miles. Not very new player friendly.

In game glitches include: not being able to interact with anything, not being able to be interacted with, clipping into map objects unable to move or be hit, not being able to die, game objects not loading in properly, random disconnects. The list goes on.

Day 3 and there is hacking abundant. Among the hacks I've personally noticed, teleportation, player tracking, instant kills, instant wins, ridiculous speed(crossing the map in less than 5 seconds).

Certain common game mechanics are in need of work or are just left out. Your character constantly makes noise, regardless of what you're doing: heavy breathing, whimpering, grunting. What this means, is hiding near the killer is almost entirely futile, you need to be able to hold your breath, at least for small amounts of time.
Healing, not too bad implementation, it needs to be slightly more intuitive, as well as medkits should have durability as a counter, not a meter. Reasoning is you can be 95% of the way through healing when the kit is destroyed, making it an entirely useless endeavor.
Repair skill checks are entirely too random, not a horrible thing, but you can get anywhere from 0-20(most I've cared to count) on a single generator. Since they are directly linked to how fast you complete the task, 0 is nothing but frustrating.

Lastly, killers camping the hooks is becoming a problem, only made more problematic by the inability to comunicate. You could possibly include a small bonus to the remaining survivors repair speed whenever someone is hooked. Call it fear determinant if you must. This will add a reason for the killer to want to leave the hooked person and stop the others from repairing, and prevent the unknowing from walking into an ambush because the would like to help, as is a very promoted tactic in the game.

[h1][b]TL;DR if you can't be bothered to read:[/b]Game has a great concept and good gameplay but is riddled with too many game-breaking bugs and missing important gameplay mechanics. Takes up to 1 hour to find a match and can't play with your friends as survivors. These bugs were present in the beta (which people reported) but Devs seem to be more concerned about $$$ than fixing bugs. Don't buy it, avoid it. Score would be 3/10[/h1]

This game has fantastic gameplay and the concept is great but the mechanics and programming are bug-filled and just horrendous.

Where do I start...first off, there are 2 missing things in the options menu. Changing resolution (game screen size) and rebinding controls. Before you start saying some games don't have this as well, keep in mind that this game costs [b]$20[/b] and is [b]NOT[/b] in Early Access.

Secondly, there is currently [b]no way[/b] to play with your friends as survivors vs a random killer, which is causing issues in joining lobbies as randoms just join and leave to see if they can get into the same lobby as their friend.

Thirdly, match-making is just horrible. They pair you up with people who have absolutely crap internet and whom live on the other side of the world, giving you 500+ ping considering this game uses a very unoptimized P2P (Peer-to-peer) connection. More importantly, you [b]will have to wait up to 1 hour[/b] (I'm not kidding) to finally find a match and start one.

Last but not least, the game is riddled with bugs and a horrible mechanic. There is a ranking system in this game but whenever the survivors are about to win or the killer is about to win, the players who are playing as them leave. This is a huge issue as a) the killer is host and b) it causes you to either [b]gain no points or lose a rank[/b]. Plenty of players are doing this and its making it nearly impossible to rank up. As for bugs, I have encountered many such as the game not ending when everyone has died, resulting in me having to quit and gaining 0 points. I have also encountered lag benefiting survivors allowing them to actually move faster than the killer, another issue.

[b]So, do I recommend this game?[/b] No. Not in its current state. As I said, it's missing plenty of important mechanics and features and the shocking part is the developers seem to be more concerned about marketing and promoting their game than actually fixing the bugs. [b]Simply look at their Twitter post here:[/b] https://twitter.com/DeadByBHVR/status/743103751150407681

[b]"No friend's mode in #DeadByBHVR ? That's right ;) surviving E3 first and then taking care of this feature!"[/b]
They seem to not give a damn about the community and even can lightheartedly joke about what is making the community angry. Mind you, I don't believe 90% of the devs are important people/representatives/PR that need to be at E3.

[h1][b]Conclusion:[/b]Please [b]don't[/b] buy this game. The devs aren't bothered with you and care more about $$$ and the bugs have been in place [b]SINCE THE BETA[/b] (many people reported them too). It's not a game worth your time, nor your money. Instead, wait for the upcoming Friday the 13th game or the "Last Year" game, which would undoubtedly be better than this. Unless you have gotten used to the bugs or don't mind the bugs, it's not worth it.[/h1]

[h1][b]Overall score: 3/10[/b][/h1]

Played 30 hours. I'm not good at this game, but while the first few hours were fun, I quickly came to realize that at the lower ranks, this game is basically repairman simulator 2K16. It is  very possible for 2-3 people to easily win at the lower ranks at the cost of the other 2 simply because the game encourages the killers to camp the hook they put a survivor on (at the lower levels at least). The entire 30 hours of my gameplay were either grab all the generators while other people are being killed, or try and save them and end up dying myself because the killer literally stands in a corner watching the hook or runs around in circles around the hook 80% of the time. 

As a killer, its very possible for a survivor to literally jump through windows or slide across boards continually to avoid you. Not only that, but unless you're the trapper, there is literally nothing you can do if you decide to stop camping a hook; if you want to guarantee yourself enough points, you basically have to camp the hook otherwise its possible for everyone to escape. 

The game is also a buggy mess. It's very hard to rank up because sometimes even if the post-game lobby shows you gaining rank, you can end up losing rank somehow. I was rank 19, got a win with 14k blood points, and I thought I would get progress toward the next rank. Turns out I didn't, and I went back to rank 20.  This happened about 8 hours in and similar problems persisted for the rest of the experience.

The game can be laggy as hell sometimes too, messing up your skill checks and can make it frustrating. And if you DC during the game, you lose rank as well. 

Most of my review is frustration not only because the ranking system is so broken. If you don't really care about ranking, then it will be very easy to overlook most of this review; this game probably seems like a game that you can easily enjoy by just having fun with your friends. Unfortunately, there is also no group queue, and the game probably isn't balaned for group play but it's okay because the devs were streaming while enjoying E3 and promised to work on it in a few weeks.

*EDIT*
Now that I've played a shit ton more and hit rank 1 both as killer and survivor, without using infinites or bp burrito or self-heal as a survivor or camping as a killer, I'll add some more.

There are 3 types of high ranking survivors: legit good ones (10% of them), infinity users (50%), and people like me (selfish dicks who only help after getting enough points); 95% of high ranking survivors got there using sabotage and sprint burst. Pretty much the key to ranking up is either being a cheeser by abusing map design (using infinites) or not being the 1st guy caught.

There are different types of killers depending on which one they are regardless of rank, since every killer should get to rank 1 eventually unless they have a legitimate mental problem: the hard camper who legit face camps you with or without insidious (most likely a hillbilly); the sxyhxy who "patrols" around hooked survivors yet always seems to be within 6 seconds of the hook and never breaks sightline or has an obstacle between them and the hooked survivor, and of course the guy who never camps but either doesn't care since he's gonna get enough BP anyway (wraith) or knows you're going to run into his trap soon (trapper/me). 

There's still no good matchmaking system but they've added Survive With Friends, which is still super buggy and you'll be lucky to find a game after 10 minutes. 

Overall, they have made the game much better, so I'll change the negative review to a positive one, but don't expect a great or balanced game.

EDIT

Another update after the Last Breath. I hit rank 1 as Trapper when the trap shows instantly. Not only does it take a second for traps to appear to survivors to interact with (disarm/sabotage), now you also can't sabotage a trap without disarming it. Not only does this make trapper even more overpowered, it also encourages even less team play. Disarm a trap = trapper knows where you are = you don't disarm traps = your teammates run into traps. This is honestly compeltely retarded, I would be shocked by these devs but after watching them play I realize they're just shitters. Stay away from this game, stay away from these devs. 2 months and the game is even less balanced than before.

EDIT

Mud DLC Update. Have over 500 hours in this game now. They just nerfed hillbilly, a killer no one wanted changed, and buffed camping trapper again, which is a killer everyone wanted nerfed. These devs try hard but they suck so bad at balancing this game.

Окей, проблему с подключением в лобби вроде как пофиксили. Что могу сказать спустя всё время, что я играл. Если вы зашли сюда, чтобы купить эту игру и получить удовольствие от игрового процесса, то я искренне не советую этого делать. Игра крайне сырая, в ней присутствует ОГРООООМНОЕ количество багов, которые игроки крайне часто юзают. Разрабы всё это знают и не фиксят. Немогут или лень. К примеру: 
Вместо 4 выживших в лобби используя баг может зайти второй маньяк. Этот баг был со времён ЗБТ, кстати.
Один из маньяков может взять оружие другого маньяка и использовать его. А если он особо наглый, то сможет использовать перки выживших, что позволит ему видить всех игроков, быстро бегать и т.д. 
Так же крайне не советую играть одному. Ибо из-за ранговой системы у Вас разорвёт пердак так, будто в него запихнули пару осколочных гранат. Вы спасаете челека с крюка, лечите его, тратите редкий аддон? Поздравляю! Вас вешают на крюк, а эта псина с 2 даже не пытается спасти Вас и сразу сваливает. 
Ещё есть маньяки аутисты. Ты маньсиш от них всю игру, пока твои товарищи чинят все геники. В итоге он кладёт тебя ноедом ( перк, который позволяет ваншотить, после того как все 5 геников заведены) и начинает фейс кемпить, а при выходе в лобби пишут, что ты нуб и это твоя вина. И ты такой * Втф, ты не мог поймать меня всю игру, а под конец кемперил, дабы хоть кого-то убить*
И ещё кое что. Иногда, когда играешь за маньяка и вешаешь челика на крюк, попадаются " люди", которые сразу бегут на спринте, дабы заныкаться поблизасти, после чего, ловят хит и начинают мансить около крюка с жертвой. После чего говорят, что ты кемпер. 
Эта игра напрочь выводит из себя. В ней тупо всё. 80% комьюнити, баги, разработчики, которые знают о их существовании и кормят завтраками в прикуску с надеждами о их скорейшем фиксе. Here is my inital problem with the beta and how I fixed it..

Dead Daylight Black screen freeze not responding launch fix
I had an issue with launching the game. When starting from steam nothing happens. Running the .exe would launch a black windowed screeen with dead by daylight and then freeze. Running as admin would launch 2 instances.. one black screen and one crashed instance. 
Drivers were fully updated, tried installing on os drive, steam said files were all verified. Searched for hours on forums and nothing helped.
Ended up working on it for a good 2 hours and figured out the cause. The game will not launch because it doesn't know what to do with the installed assets. I figured out the config files were not populating after install.
They are located under C:\Users\*YOURUSERNAME\AppData\Local\DeadByDaylight\Saved\Config\WindowsNoEditor
You need to enable show hidden files and folders
check the .ini files and see if they are populated. If they are blank then you have the same issue as me!
I had to install on another computer and the .inis were filled. I then copied them over to this desktop and replaced the files.
For reference the computer it did not work on specs are as followed:
Amd 8-core 4.0 ghz processor
16 gbs ram
Sapphire 390 x 8gb vram
The computer it installed correctly on:
Amd 8-core 3.8 ghz processor
16 gb ram
2 Powercolor 6970 2 gb vram in crossfire
I uploaded the config files to a file hosting site. Please comment if they work for you or need to be reuploaded.

Feels unfinished. Basically, after 2 hours played I've seen 2 different maps (which actually look almost the same) both focused on the survivors starting generators to open a door. Every single game feels the same. The game's settings are horribly lacking. The only audio setting is for all audio, you can't turn down the music which often overwhelms other audio, especially when you're trying to listen for breathing and footsteps. The controls are completely non-customizable, and the only graphics setting is a general quality slider that runs from low to ultra, and the game doesn't look great even on the highest one. Poor textures, very poor anisotropic filtering, dodgy antialiasing, but still an overfocus on volumetric effects like fog that makes the framerate drop considerably at times.

There are 3 different killers, each with different secondary skills, but there is only one of them worth using whatsoever (the hillbilly's chainsaw). Especially the wraith's invisibility bell is worthless, as you can't attack while invisible and exiting the invisibility takes just as long as entering it takes, several seconds, during which you're required to stand still. The trapper's bear traps aren't useless but they're really not worth the effort, and you yourself can get trapped in them if you walk too close. That's another issue, the position tracking for multiplayer is dodgy. This was especially evident as a survivor, as in the third person perspective, your player model glitching around while moving is extremely jarring. Even entering a locker to hide in will often have a bug where the animation plays out to the side of the locker. If a killer has downed a survivor and is picking them up, the model of the survivor's body being picked up will also glitch into the killer player's field of view so they can see inside the model.

Absolutely just an unfinished game. Can't understand how this is already touted as a full release. I had some fun, but mainly due to the people I played it with. Can't wait to see how the similar game Last Year is going to handle this, at least they're promising a lot more varied maps.

This game is pretty fun and I definitely enjoy playing it, at least privately with friends. However, there are some issues that need to be addressed, but I'll also try to address the pros.

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Fun style of gameplay with different randomly generated maps makes it more interesting as you can't just find one spot that's hidden well all the time, or camp the trap door.
- If completeing all the generators is too hard as the last alive, you can find a trap door as a second route.
- Multiple types of killers (only 3 at the moment of writing this) makes each game a bit different based on how the person behind the killer plays.

I definitely do enjoy this game, but there are things that need to be fixed which are easier to list. Don't take the number of cons as a bad sign necessarily.

[h1]Cons:[/h1]
- No party system, so the only way to play with friends is a private lobby.
- If Steam servers go offline during a game, you remain connected but cannot move. You continue to see everything changing in the server, but cannot interact. Waiting for it Steam Servers to reconnect does not allow you to play.
- If someone disconnects from the game due to an internet issue, the trap door will not appear.
- Killers don't have incentives to not camp the meathook you're on. In public games, this causes issues with the killer watching you die so you can never be rescued. Kind of unfair.
- Sounds sometimes broken. When playing with friends privately, we've had issues where someone isn't able to hear the Wraith's bells ring, which while not completely game breaking, does affect gameplay.
- The flashlight will claim to have blinded the killer and give you points, however multiple times when I have received this notification, the person who was the killer will still follow and track me, claiming they were never actually blind.
- It feels like there are quite a lot of meathooks. Rarely am I actually able to wiggle away from the killer, which with camping killers, makes one down end game a lot of the time.

[h1]Things worth mentioning:[/h1]
- There are more pros and cons to this game, if I think of any others I will add them to this review. However, right now the pros do not outweigh the cons for public play. In private games, I tend to have a lot more fun because we can sit in a voice server and hear reactions/taunting, as well as yell at people for doing something unfair. If someone is camping, we can ask them not to do it, which they tend to listen to. This makes private games the way to go.
- You cannot earn XP or anything in private games, which I can understand would be to stop someone from boosting their level, but for those who want to play seriously and with friends, can be a bit annoying.
- The recovery system after being downed and left on the ground by the killer is annoying because you can't fully recover. I understand it is to make the healing process for a friend faster, but when you're last alive if you get downed you're basically done.

Regardless, this game is still fun, and I do enjoy playing it privately with friends. However with the current state of the game, public play can be a hit or a miss. I'd still recommend it if you can get a group of people to play with.

Good game, but is flawed in several ways. The matchmaking is bugged, expect many disconnects. If a player decides to rage quit, you lose any points gathered along with items and even your rank will drop. 

Currently there is only one type of objective, which may get old after a while. Fix some generators, open a door and escape while evading a killer. Some variety would be nice. 

Some additional balancing should be done on both sides. It can be difficult to get lost as the hunter if the survivors are very coordinated. The game gives some visual cues, but I feel like there could be some more to aid the killer, especially when there is only one survivor left.

Small details like giving the survivors more emotion are missing. When struggling on a hook and having a neutral blank face detracts from the mood. Some idle chatter would be helpful with the lack of VOIP. The most there is are panicked cries when injured. 

I  really want to recommend this game, but in its current state, I just can't. I'm enjoying it personally, but it feels like I just bought in to an early access title.
